result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel L Dejesus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

***AMENDED 5-10-2017: To reflect correct amount of time served of 16 days.***
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No association with gang members.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, follow-up on mental health concerns and psych eval if necessary. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Samuel L Dejesus in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
PSI corrections made, no additions.
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

BTC:
15CF1450: Ct. 1: I/S 2 yrs, 1 yrs. IC, 1 yr. ES, consecutive to 15CF1163, 2 yrs. probation.

15CF1163: Ct. 1: I/S 2 yrs, 1 yrs. IC, 1 yrs. ES, 2 yrs. probation.

Conditions:
As to 15CF1450: 6 mos. RCJ, CFTS, balance stayed to be used at agent's discretion.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances.
Random UA's and breathalyzers.
AODA assessment.
Obtain GED.
Obtain and Maintain full time employment.
DOC to follow-up on mental health concerns and psych eval if necessary.
No association with gang members, drug dealers, or drug users.
Court costs and surcharges.
DNA sample.

FAW/VOTE
Eligible for CIP and SAP.

Preliminary hearing on August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Samuel L Dejesus in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Samuel L Dejesus in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
